formulas.name: Standard Limit (sin)
formulas.description: Most fundamental trig limit, x must be in radians

formulas.name: Standard Limit (tan)
formulas.description: Follows from sinx/x limit

formulas.name: Standard Limit (1−cos)
formulas.description: Common limit involving cosine

formulas.name: Standard Limit (exponential)
formulas.description: Fundamental exponential limit

formulas.name: Standard Limit (logarithm)
formulas.description: Fundamental logarithmic limit

formulas.name: Standard Limit (a^x)
formulas.description: General exponential limit

formulas.name: Definition of e
formulas.description: Euler's number definition as a limit

formulas.name: Standard Limit (power)
formulas.description: Useful for algebraic limits

formulas.name: L'Hôpital's Rule
formulas.formula: lim f(x)/g(x) = lim f'(x)/g'(x) when 0/0 or ∞/∞
formulas.description: Differentiate numerator and denominator SEPARATELY. Can apply repeatedly.
formulas.use_case: Use when direct substitution gives 0/0 or ∞/∞

formulas.name: Squeeze (Sandwich) Theorem
formulas.formula: If g(x) ≤ f(x) ≤ h(x) and lim g = lim h = L, then lim f = L
formulas.description: Useful when direct computation is difficult

formulas.name: Derivative (First Principle)
formulas.description: Definition of derivative from first principles

formulas.name: Continuity Condition
formulas.formula: f is continuous at x=a if lim(x→a) f(x) = f(a)
formulas.description: Three conditions: f(a) exists, limit exists, they are equal

formulas.name: Differentiability Condition
formulas.description: Left-hand derivative must equal right-hand derivative. Differentiable ⟹ Continuous (but NOT vice versa)
formulas.example: f(x) = |x| is continuous but NOT differentiable at x = 0

formulas.name: Power Rule
formulas.description: Most basic differentiation rule

formulas.name: Product Rule
formulas.description: Derivative of product of two functions

formulas.name: Quotient Rule
formulas.description: Derivative of quotient

formulas.name: Chain Rule
formulas.description: Derivative of composite function f(g(x))

formulas.name: Rolle's Theorem
formulas.formula: If f(a) = f(b), then ∃c ∈ (a,b) such that f'(c) = 0
formulas.description: Special case of MVT when f(a) = f(b). f must be continuous on [a,b] and differentiable on (a,b).

formulas.name: Mean Value Theorem
formulas.formula: f'(c) = [f(b) − f(a)]/(b − a) for some c ∈ (a,b)
formulas.description: Guarantees existence of point where instantaneous rate equals average rate

formulas.name: Implicit Differentiation
formulas.formula: Differentiate both sides w.r.t. x, treat y as function of x
formulas.description: Used when y cannot be explicitly written as function of x
